title: Honoring Susan Ordonez upon the occasion of her retirement after more than 27 years of distinguished service to Community Board No. 3
fulltext:
LEGISLATIVE  RESOLUTION  honoring Susan Ordonez upon the occasion of her
retirement after more than 27 years of distinguished service to Communi-
ty Board No. 3

WHEREAS, This Legislative Body seeks to  acknowledge  those  individuals
whose  professional lives and civic endeavors serve to enhance the stat-
ure of the State of New York; and
  WHEREAS, Attendant to such concern, and in full accord with its  long-
standing  traditions,  this  Legislative  Body  is justly proud to honor
Susan Ordonez upon the occasion of her retirement  after  more  than  27
years  of distinguished service to Community Board No. 3; she will offi-
cially retire on Friday, January 28, 2011; and
  WHEREAS, For almost three decades, Susan  Ordonez  rendered  faithful,
conscientious and valuable service as Community Coordinator of Community
Board No. 3, serving the neighborhoods of East Elmhurst, Jackson Heights
and  North  Corona, helping to improve the quality of life for the resi-
dents of the community; and
  WHEREAS, In this capacity, Susan Ordonez was responsible for  process-
ing  complaints related to HPD, Fire, Police and Building Departments as
well as multiple agency grievances; and
  WHEREAS, Over the years, Susan Ordonez developed many strong relation-
ships with residents within the community, particularly the senior citi-
zens; and
  WHEREAS, She served  with  loyalty,  honor  and  distinction  and  was
governed  by  a  keen  sense of duty and always showed a unique grasp of
human problems; known for being extremely  resourceful  and  persistent,
Susan  Ordonez takes great pleasure in a challenge and enjoys working to
resolve complex problems; and
  WHEREAS, The wife of the late Henry  Ordonez,  Susan  Ordonez  is  the
proud  mother of two children, and the loving grandmother of four grand-
children; and
  WHEREAS, It is the sense of  this  Legislative  Body  that  those  who
enhance the quality of life in their community and have shown a long and
sustained  commitment  to  the  maintenance  of  high standards in their
profession, certainly have earned the recognition and  applause  of  all
the citizens of this great Empire State; now, therefore, be it
  RESOLVED,  That  this  Legislative  Body pause in its deliberations to
honor Susan Ordonez upon the occasion of her retirement after more  than
27  years  of  distinguished service to Community Board No. 3; and be it
further
  RESOLVED, That a copy of this Resolution, suitably engrossed, be tran-
smitted to Susan Ordonez.
